sam-description:
Commercial Solution Opening

Customer Care Prototyping

HT0038-25-S-C002

gabriela.y.hurte.civ@health.mil

November 4, 2025

1. Agency Name 

Defense Health Agency (DHA)

2. Issuing Acquisition Office

Defense Health Agency, Defense Healthcare Management Systems - Contracting Division (DHMS-CD) in support of the Program Executive Office (PEO) – Defense Healthcare Management Systems (DHMS)

3. Funding Opportunity Title

Customer Care Prototyping 2025-2026

4. Reserved

5. Announcement Type

Notice of Availability (NoA), Commercial Solutions Opening (CSO) IAW 10 U.S.C. § 4022. PEO DHMS is interested in awarding other transaction agreements under the authority of 10 U.S.C. § 4022 to carry out prototype projects that are, among other things, directly relevant to enhancing the mission effectiveness of personnel of the Department of Defense, in particular for Customer Care activities outlined in this NoA. A prototype project includes, but is not limited to, a project that addresses:

(A) a proof of concept, model, or process, including a business process;

(B) reverse engineering to address obsolescence;

(C) a pilot or novel application of commercial technologies for defense purposes;

(D) agile development activity;

(E) the creation, design, development, or demonstration of operational utility; or

(F) any combination of subparagraphs (A) through (E).M

An Agreement awarded under the authority of 10 U.S.C. § 4022 and is not subject to the Competition in Contracting Act, the Federal Acquisition Regulation, or the Defense Federal Acquisition Regulation Supplement. Any successful prototype project (or portion thereof) awarded under this CSO may be selected for a follow-on production agreement or contract pursuant to 10 U.S.C. § 4022(f).

The Government reserves the right to revise this NOA to include other types of CSOs, such as DFARS 212.7004 in the future. Applicable instructions to the relevant authority will be added, if required.

See attachments for additional information relating to this CSO HT0038-25-S-C002.

HT0038-25-S-C002 - Notice of Availability - Customer Care_04NOV25
sweetspot-summary: The Defense Health Agency (DHA) is initiating a Commercial Solutions Opening (CSO) titled "Customer Care Prototyping 2025-2026" aimed at developing innovative solutions to enhance customer care within the Military Health System (MHS). The objective is to solicit prototype projects under the authority of 10 U.S.C. § 4022 that address challenges such as slow technology adoption and to establish a Customer Care Foundational Platform that emphasizes agile development, self-service support, and data-driven insights. This initiative is crucial for improving mission effectiveness and customer sentiment while reducing dependency on human resources and overall costs. Interested parties should contact Gabriela Hurte at gabriela.y.hurte.civ@health.mil or Sonya Edom at sonya.m.edom.civ@health.mil for further details, with the notice of availability issued on November 4, 2025.
highergov-summary:
Background
The Defense Health Agency (DHA) is issuing this solicitation to support the development and procurement of solutions for the Military Health System (MHS), which provides integrated healthcare support for warfighters.

The goal of this contract, titled 'Customer Care Prototyping 2025-2026', is to enhance mission effectiveness through innovative customer care activities. This initiative is part of a broader digital transformation effort by the Program Executive Office – Defense Healthcare Management Systems (PEO DHMS) to implement a product/platform operating model that supports various healthcare solutions.

Work Details
The contract involves prototype projects that may include:
(A) proof of concept, model, or process;
(B) reverse engineering to address obsolescence;
(C) pilot or novel applications of commercial technologies for defense;
(D) agile development activities;
(E) creation, design, development, or demonstration of operational utility; or
(F) combinations of the above.

The fundamental purpose is to enable rapid responses to customer needs and evolve customer-facing product support capabilities. Key areas of interest include proactive service management, embedding customer experience in product lifecycles, utilizing emerging technologies like machine learning and automation, maximizing user self-service, and adopting innovative payment models. The overarching goal is to reduce delays in product launches, minimize human intervention, and improve customer sentiment.

Period of Performance
The contract will be performed over the 2025-2026 timeframe with specific timelines established during individual submission seasons.

Place of Performance
The geographic location for performance is not explicitly stated but may involve various locations relevant to the Department of Defense's operations.

sam-description: Proposed procurement for NSN 4820013943327 VALVE,CHECK: Line 0001 Qty 15 UI EA Deliver To: W1A8 DLA DISTRIBUTION By: 0077 DAYS ADO The solicitation is an RFQ and will be available at the link provided in this notice. Hard copies of this solicitation are not available. Digitized drawings and Military Specifications and Standards may be retrieved, or ordered, electronically. All responsible sources may submit a quote which, if timely received, shall be considered. Quotes must be submitted electronically.
sweetspot-summary: The Department of Defense, through the Defense Logistics Agency (DLA) Land and Maritime, is seeking quotes for the procurement of 15 units of a check valve (NSN 4820013943327). This solicitation is part of a total small business set-aside initiative and aims to fulfill specific military requirements for valve components critical to various defense applications. Interested vendors are encouraged to submit their quotes electronically, as hard copies of the solicitation will not be available, and all submissions must be received within the specified timeframe. For inquiries, potential bidders can contact the DLA via email at DibbsBSM@dla.mil, and further details can be accessed through the DLA's electronic solicitation platform.

All responsible sources may submit a quote which, if timely received, shall be considered. Quotes must be submitted electronically.

sam-description:
04 Nov 2025 Update:  The purpose of this notice update is to incorporate the Draft Solicitation and updated contemplated acquisition dates.  Anticipated Site Visits/Pre-Proposal Conference: Site Visits 12-19 November 2025; Pre-Proposal Conference 06 January 2026.  Anticipated RFP Release Date: 05 January 2026.  Anticipated Award Date: 19 August 2026.   All information contained herein is preliminary and for informational purposes only. This DRAFT RFP does not constitute a commitment by the United States Government, nor does it create any obligation on the part of the Government in any way.  Further information will be provided, as it becomes known.

02 July 2025:  The Naval Air Warfare Center Training Systems Division (NAWCTSD) is considering executing this effort under the FTSS V Multiple Award Contract (MAC). In accordance with FAR 16.505 (b)(1), NAWCTSD intends to provide fair opportunity for award of a Firm Fixed Price Task Order under FTSS V Lot 1 (Unrestricted) for Contractor Operation and Maintenance Services (COMS) and Contractor Maintenance Services (CMS) in support of Chief of Naval Air training (CNATRA) at NAS Corpus Christi, TX, NAS Kingsville, TX, NAS Whiting Field, FL, NAS Pensacola, FL, and NAS Meridian, MS. The period of performance is 62 months, inclusive of two (2) month mobilization and one (1) twelve (12) month base year with four (4) twelve (12) month options. Start of contractor performance (Mobilization) anticipated to be 01 November 2026. This effort will be awarded under FTSS V, Lot I and will be limited to Lot I MAC holders only. A list of FTSS V Lot 1 Points of Contact is included with this notice for possible subcontracting opportunities. Anticipated Site Visits/Pre-Proposal Conference: Site Visits 20 October 2025 through 31 October 2025. Pre-Proposal Conference 03 November 2025. Anticipated RFP Release Date: 20 October 2025. Anticipated Award Date: 19 August 2026. Other Information: Predecessor Contract: N6134022F0014, Fidelity Technologies Corporation. The Service Contract Labor Standards Statute is applicable. Be advised that the aforementioned information is anticipatory in nature and is not binding. Further information will be provided, as it becomes known.
sweetspot-summary: The Department of Defense, through the Naval Air Warfare Center Training Systems Division (NAWCTSD), is seeking proposals for Contractor Operation and Maintenance Services (COMS) under the Field Training Systems Support (FTSS V) Multiple Award Contract (MAC) Lot I. This procurement aims to provide comprehensive operational and maintenance support for the Chief of Naval Air Training (CNATRA) at various Naval Air Stations, including NAS Corpus Christi, NAS Kingsville, NAS Whiting Field, NAS Pensacola, and NAS Meridian, with a performance period of 62 months, starting with a two-month mobilization phase anticipated to begin on November 1, 2026. The services are critical for maintaining training aids and devices, ensuring effective training operations for naval personnel. Interested contractors must prepare for site visits scheduled from October 20 to October 31, 2025, and a pre-proposal conference on November 3, 2025, with the draft RFP expected to be released on October 20, 2025, and the anticipated award date set for August 19, 2026. For further inquiries, contact Janet Fondriest at janet.l.fondriest.civ@us.navy.mil or Jana McEntegart at jana.r.mcentegart.civ@us.navy.mil.
highergov-summary:
Background
The Naval Air Warfare Center Training Systems Division (NAWCTSD) is planning to execute a contract under the FTSS V Multiple Award Contract (MAC) to provide Contractor Operation and Maintenance Services (COMS) and Contractor Maintenance Services (CMS) in support of the Chief of Naval Air Training (CNATRA).

The contract will specifically support operations at multiple Naval Air Stations including NAS Corpus Christi, TX, NAS Kingsville, TX, NAS Whiting Field, FL, NAS Pensacola, FL, and NAS Meridian, MS.

Work Details
The contractor will be responsible for providing comprehensive operation and maintenance services as outlined in the solicitation. This includes ensuring the operational readiness of training systems and equipment utilized by CNATRA.

The tasks may involve routine maintenance, troubleshooting, repairs, and operational support to facilitate training missions. Specific requirements will be detailed in the Statement of Work (SOW) provided with the solicitation.

Period of Performance
The period of performance for this contract is anticipated to be 62 months. This includes a two-month mobilization period followed by a base year of twelve months and four additional twelve-month options.

Place of Performance
The contract will be performed at various locations including NAS Corpus Christi, TX; NAS Kingsville, TX; NAS Whiting Field, FL; NAS Pensacola, FL; and NAS Meridian, MS.

sam-description:
Solicitation Number: 6137322

Notice Type: Pre-Solicitation Notice

This notice does NOT constitute a request for proposal, request for quote, or invitation for bid. The work is for Elevator Maintenance and Repairs located at Naval Submarine Base New London, Groton CT. The work includes, but is not limited to, providing all labor, supervision, management, tools, materials, equipment, facilities, transportation, incidental engineering and other items necessary to provide the services as described in the Performance Work Statement of the Request for Proposal (RFP). The services will be acquired using commercial procedures under FAR Part 12.  A Firm Fixed Price (FFP) Indefinite Delivery Indefinite Quantity (IDIQ) Contract is anticipated.

The contract term will be a base period of twelve (12) month plus four twelve (12) month options.  Only the base period of the contract will offer a minimum guarantee.  The Government intends to award a contract resulting from this solicitation to the responsible offeror with the Lowest Price and Technically Acceptable Proposal based on the following evaluation factors:

Price
Corporate Experience
Past Performance
The offeror’s proposal shall contain a response to each of the evaluation factors in the form prescribed by the solicitation. The resulting contract will be awarded to the responsible offeror whose proposal, conforming to the Request for Proposal, will be most advantageous to the Government. Price, base plus options, and all other evaluation factors will be considered.

The Procurement Method shall be Contracting by Negotiation.

 The proposed contract listed here is Unrestricted. The NAICS Code for this procurement is 811310 and the annual Small Business size standard is $12,500,000 in annual receipts.

Prospective contractors must register in the System for Award Management (SAM) at  https://www.sam.gov database prior to award. Bidders are hereby notified that failure to register may render their firm ineligible for award. Specifications and drawings will not be directly provided in a paper hard copy format or CD-ROM. The address for downloading this synopsis is https://www.sam.gov.

All prospective offerors are encouraged to register on the above website for this procurement when specifications and associated documents become available. Notification of any changes to this solicitation (i.e. amendments) shall be made only on the web site. It is therefore the offeror’s responsibility to check the web site daily for any posted changes to the solicitation.

Offerors should submit verification of their firm's registration in the SAM Database with their proposal. Online Representations and Certifications will be required on this contract per clause FAR 52.204-8 Annual Representations and Certifications, available on the FAR website https://www.acquisition.gov.

The Solicitation shall be available on or about 17 November 2025. Proposals will be due on or about 15 December 2025. The Pre-Proposal Conference or Site Visit will be scheduled on or about 25 November 2025. The Issue date, Proposal Due date, and Award date stated in this notice are approximates. 
 

Contracting Office Address: NAVFAC PWD Bldg 135 Box 400, New London Submarine Base, Groton CT 06349-5026

Place of Performance: New London Submarine Base, Groton CT 06349-5026 US

Point of Contact(s): Rebecca Spaulding  rebecca.j.spaulding.civ@us.navy.mil
sweetspot-summary: The Department of Defense, through the Naval Facilities Engineering Command (NAVFAC), is seeking contractors to provide elevator maintenance and repair services at the Naval Submarine Base in New London, Connecticut. The procurement involves a comprehensive range of services, including labor, supervision, management, and necessary materials and equipment to maintain various types of elevators, escalators, and lifts, as detailed in the extensive inventory of the base. This contract, anticipated to be a Firm Fixed Price Indefinite Delivery Indefinite Quantity (IDIQ), will be awarded based on the lowest price and technical acceptability, with proposals due around December 15, 2025. Interested contractors must register in the System for Award Management (SAM) and can contact Rebecca Spaulding at rebecca.j.spaulding.civ@us.navy.mil for further information.
highergov-summary:
Background
The contract is issued by the Naval Submarine Base New London, which is the Navy's first submarine base and serves as the home of the submarine force. Established in 1868, it occupies over 687 acres and supports more than 70 tenant commands.

The goal of this contract is to provide elevator maintenance and repair services at the base, ensuring operational efficiency and safety for the facilities.

Work Details
The contractor shall provide all labor, supervision, management, tools, materials, equipment, facilities, transportation, incidental engineering, and other items necessary to perform elevator maintenance and repairs as outlined in the Performance Work Statement (PWS). The work includes both recurring and non-recurring tasks.

The PWS consists of multiple annexes detailing specific requirements:
- Annex 1 provides general information;
- Annex 2 outlines management and administration requirements;
- Annexes 3 through 18 cover technical requirements related to various operational aspects.

The contractor must also be prepared to acquire additional work as needed within the scope of the contract.

Period of Performance
The contract will have a base period of twelve months with four additional twelve-month options available for extension.

Place of Performance
Naval Submarine Base New London, Groton CT 06349-5026 US

sam-description:
Title: Instrument Calibration and Preventative Maintenance Services/Repair for four (4) Tinius Olsen, RIA-JMTC Materials Science Lab at Rock Island Arsenal

Product Service Code: J049

NAICS Code: 334519

This is a Sources Sought Notice and NOT a solicitation announcement.  The purpose of this notice is to gain knowledge of potential qualified sources for the Instrument Calibration and Preventative Maintenance Services/Repair for four (4) Tinius Olsen, RIA-JMTC Materials Science Lab at Rock Island Arsenal in support of the Joint Manufacturing and Technology Center (JMTC). 

The U.S. Army Contracting Command-Rock Island (ACC-RI) is seeking sources only. ACC-RI intends to consider all capability statements when developing its finalized acquisition strategy and resulting solicitation(s).

Please submit all capability statements as outlined below by 12:00 P.M. CST on November 11, 2025, by email to angel.j.traman.civ@army.mil.

This is for information only which may be used for planning purposes and should not be construed as a Request for Quote or as an obligation on the part of the Government. The Government does not intend to award a contract on the basis of this request or otherwise pay for the information solicited. ACC-RI will only utilize the information you provide in developing its acquisition approach for future requirements.

Please provide a capability statement to include supporting information and documents to support the vendor’s ability to perform this requirement in accordance with Attachment 0001 – DRAFT Statement of Work (SOW). The capability statement should clearly address the following areas:

Vendor’s Size Standard, DUNS Number, EUI, Cage Code
Accredited in ISO/IEC 17025 or equivalent to standard ISO standards.
Qualified personnel to be performed by factory certified representatives.
Qualified personnel provide unlimited phone support.
Personnel shall provide unlimited emergency on-site support within 2 business days.
sweetspot-summary: The Department of Defense, through the U.S. Army Contracting Command-Rock Island (ACC-RI), is seeking qualified vendors to provide Instrument Calibration and Preventative Maintenance Services/Repair for four Tinius Olsen testing machines at the RIA-JMTC Materials Science Lab located at Rock Island Arsenal, Illinois. The procurement includes calibration, routine maintenance, and repair services, requiring contractors to be ISO/IEC 17025 accredited and to employ factory-certified personnel capable of providing unlimited phone support and emergency on-site assistance within two business days. This opportunity is critical for ensuring the operational integrity of essential testing equipment used in materials science, and interested parties must submit their capability statements by 12:00 P.M. CST on November 11, 2025, to Angel Traman at angel.j.traman.civ@army.mil, as this notice is for information gathering and not a solicitation for contract award.

sam-description:
The Lt. Col. Luke Weathers, Jr. Veterans Affairs Medical Center requires Portable Fire Extinguisher Maintenance and Inspection Services as outling in the Statement of Work contained herein. The period of performance will be 11/01/2025-09/30/2026. 

Questions are due no later than 2:00 PM CT 10/24/2025.

Quotes are due no later than 10:00 AM CT 10/29/2025.

 All questions and quotes must be submitted in writing via email to Elyse.McVey@va.gov 

This modification extends the Quote due date to 10:00 am CT 11/05/2025 because the COR has not provided answers to questions that have been asked. The Contracting Officer will accept revisions to quotes already submitted once the questions and answers have been posted.

This modification is to post the questions and answers. 

This modification offers a site visit as outlined in the attached modification and extends the Quote due date to 10:00 am CT 11/12/2025.
sweetspot-summary: The Department of Veterans Affairs is seeking proposals for Portable Fire Extinguisher Maintenance and Inspection Services at the Lt. Col. Luke Weathers, Jr. Veterans Affairs Medical Center in Memphis, Tennessee. The contract requires comprehensive maintenance, including monthly inspections, hydrostatic testing, and quarterly hood cleaning for various fire safety systems, ensuring compliance with NFPA standards and OSHA regulations. This service is critical for maintaining safety and compliance within the medical center and associated facilities, covering a total of 687 extinguishers and multiple inspection sites. Interested parties must submit their quotes by November 12, 2025, at 10:00 AM CST, and can direct inquiries to Nicole McVey at Elyse.McVey@va.gov or by phone at 615-225-6502. This opportunity is set aside for Service-Disabled Veteran-Owned Small Businesses, with a NAICS code of 811310.
highergov-summary:
Background
The Lt. Col. Luke Weathers, Jr. Veterans Affairs Medical Center, part of the Department of Veterans Affairs, is seeking to ensure the safety and compliance of its facilities by requiring Portable Fire Extinguisher Maintenance and Inspections. This contract aims to meet federal certification and state licensure requirements for healthcare facilities, ensuring that fire extinguishers are properly inspected, tested, and maintained.

Work Details
The contractor will provide monthly inspection, testing, and maintenance for all portable fire extinguishers and extinguishing systems at VAMC Memphis facilities and vehicles. Responsibilities include:

- Furnishing all supervision, licensed personnel, equipment, tools, labor, materials, parts, transportation, and waste disposal necessary for the work.
- Repairing or replacing portable fire extinguishers as part of normal maintenance.
- Ensuring serviceability in accordance with National Fire Protection Association (NFPA) standards.
- Conducting 5-year hydrostatic testing, 6-year maintenance, and 12-year hydrostatic testing.
- Performing monthly inspections as per OSHA regulations which include checking that fire extinguishers are in their assigned place, not blocked or hidden, mounted according to NFPA standards, showing adequate pressure, having intact pins and seals, free from damage or abuse, nozzles free of blockage or corrosion, and cleaned.
- Providing advice on necessary repairs.
- Designating a responsible person for performance oversight.

Period of Performance
The contract period is expected to be from November 1, 2025 through September 30, 2026.

Place of Performance
The services will be performed at the Lt. Col. Luke Weathers Jr. Veterans Affairs Medical Center located in Memphis, TN.

sam-description:
The Department of the Air Force (“DAF”) is accepting proposals for the development of Artificial Intelligence (“AI”) data centers (“Projects”). These Projects are in accordance with Executive Order 14179: Removing Barriers to American Leadership in Artificial Intelligence dated 23 January 2025 and Executive Order 14318: Accelerating Federal Permitting of Data Center Infrastructure dated 23 July 2025. Projects must, at a minimum, be “Qualifying Projects” as defined in Executive Order 14318 (at Appendix A) including, but not limited to, a facility that requires greater than 100 megawatts (MW) of new load and a Project of at least $500M in capital expenditures. As consideration for leasing its parcels to developers selected under this RFLP, DAF is seeking monetary consideration for the AI data center. If an onsite power generation component is included in the proposal, then the DAF will require the first right of refusal to power generation.
Executive Order 13327, Federal Real Property Asset Management, establishes “It is the policy of the United States to promote the efficient and economical use of America’s real property assets and to assure management accountability for implementing Federal real property management reforms.” Furthermore, policy from the Deputy Assistant Secretary of the Air Force (Installations) directs, “The Air Force cannot afford to disregard or discount the value of any asset, and we must optimize the real and potential value of those assets ….”
a. 10 U.S.C. § 2667 (the “Enabling Statute”), as amended, allows the Government to lease real property to non-Federal entities in exchange for consideration in an amount that is not less than the fair market value of the leasehold interest.
b. Pursuant to the foregoing Executive Orders and the Enabling Statute, the DAF (herein, the “Government”) is issuing this Request for Lease Proposal (this “RFLP”) to solicit proposals from qualified entities (individually an “Offeror” and collectively “Offerors”) interested in leasing from the Government one or more underutilized parcels of land (each a “Property” and collectively the “Properties”) for private commercial data center use on Arnold Air Force Base (AFB), TN, Edwards AFB, CA, Joint Base McGuire-Dix-Lakehurst (JBMDL), NJ, Davis- Monthan AFB, AZ, and Robins AFB, GA (each, an “Installation” and collectively, the “Installations”), which are all active military installations located within the contiguous United States. Each Property and associated acreage is depicted in Appendix B-1 through B-5 of this RFLP (“Depiction of Properties”), along with additional information. Offerors are not required to submit development proposals for all Installations but instead can choose to submit proposals for Installations in which the Offeror feels a project is commercially viable. The Government may purchase AI Data Center services and power from the Project(s) but is under no obligation to do so.
c. In accordance with and subject to the terms, requirements, and conditions of this RFLP, the Government will evaluate all proposals received to select one or more Offerors as potential lessee(s) with whom to enter into lease negotiations
(individually a “Potential Lessee” and collectively “Potential Lessees”). A Potential Lessee(s) with whom the Government executes a legally binding written long-term ground lease agreement (“Lease”) is hereinafter referred to in this RFLP as a “Lessee(s).” A Potential Lessee(s) may not actually become a Lessee if lease negotiations are not successful.

Primary NAICS codes include:
531190 Lessors of Other Real Estate Property

Responses are due no later than 5:00 PM Central Time on 14 November 2025.
Please direct all pertinent questions to David Mairs david.mairs@us.af.mil or 361-290-3400
Attachments: Attachment 1 - RFLP No. AFCEC-26-R-0002
sweetspot-summary: The Department of the Air Force is soliciting proposals for the development of Artificial Intelligence (AI) data centers at multiple military installations, including Arnold AFB, TN, Davis-Monthan AFB, AZ, Edwards AFB, CA, Joint Base McGuire-Dix-Lakehurst, NJ, and Robins AFB, GA. Proposals must meet specific criteria outlined in Executive Orders 14179 and 14318, requiring projects to exceed 100 megawatts of new load and involve a minimum of $500 million in capital expenditures. This initiative aims to optimize the use of underutilized federal real estate for commercial purposes while ensuring compliance with federal property management policies. Interested parties must submit their proposals by 5:00 PM Central Time on November 14, 2025, and can direct inquiries to David Mairs at david.mairs@us.af.mil or by phone at 361-290-3400.
highergov-summary:
Background
The Department of the Air Force (DAF) is issuing a Request for Lease Proposal (RFLP) for the development of Artificial Intelligence (AI) data centers in accordance with Executive Orders aimed at enhancing American leadership in AI and accelerating federal permitting for data center infrastructure.

The goal is to lease underutilized parcels of land at various military installations for private commercial data center use, with a focus on projects that require significant capital investment and energy load.

Work Details
The selected Offerors will be responsible for developing AI data centers that meet the criteria of 'Qualifying Projects' as defined in Executive Order 14318, which includes facilities requiring over 100 megawatts (MW) of new load and a minimum of $500 million in capital expenditures.

The Offerors must provide monetary consideration for leasing the properties and may include an onsite power generation component, granting DAF first right of refusal to any generated power. The objectives include optimizing property use, maximizing cash consideration to DAF, minimizing impacts on DAF missions and surrounding communities, adhering to best commercial practices, and ensuring positive relations with local authorities.

Each property will be leased 'as-is,' and Offerors must conduct their own due diligence regarding suitability for development. Proposals must include detailed plans covering project description, market analysis, development timelines, environmental management, utility interconnections, and compliance with applicable laws.

Period of Performance
The contract period will span multiple years as determined by the project development timelines outlined in the proposals submitted by Offerors.

Place of Performance
The contract will be performed at Arnold Air Force Base (AFB), TN; Edwards AFB, CA; Joint Base McGuire-Dix-Lakehurst (JBMDL), NJ; Davis-Monthan AFB, AZ; and Robins AFB, GA.

sam-description:
Amendment - 11.04.2025:  The purpose of this amendment is to add an updated Questions and Answers attachment to the Attachments/Links section.

Amendment - 10.23.2025:  The purpose of this amendment is to add an updated Questions and Answers attachment to the Attachments/Links section.

Amendment - 10.22.2025: The purpose of this amendment is to add a Questions and Answers attachment to the Attachments/Links section.

Amendment - 10.21.2025:  The purpose of this amendment is to add a Questions and Answers attachment to the Attachments/Links section and extend the closing date to November 5, 2025, 3:00 PM CT.

I.         INTRODUCTION / PURPOSE

The Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) Supply Chain Management - Enterprise Resource Planning (SCM-ERP) platform includes an IFS ERP with interfaces to other FAA systems.  The FAA is seeking experienced expert services to advise the FAA on industry’s best practices for the technical and business process application of the IFS ERP within the FAA Supply Chain context. The contractor is expected to already possess expertise in applying the industry’s best practices in the application of the IFS ERP in a Supply Chain context and is expected to quickly gain an understanding and expertise on the FAA application and processes so as to advise and recommend courses of action to the FAA.  Interested parties should review the attached Draft Performance Work Statement (PWS) and propose appropriate Labor Categories for the required services.

This market survey announcement is issued in accordance with the FAA Acquisition Management System (AMS) Policy at 3.2.1.2.1.

This is not a Screening Information Request (SIR) or Request for Proposal (RFP) of any kind. The responses to this Market survey will be used for informational purposes only. The FAA is not seeking or accepting unsolicited proposals. Responders are advised that the FAA will not pay for any information received or for administrative costs incurred in preparing a response to the Market survey. Any costs associated with responding to this survey are solely at the interested company’s expense. Companies who choose not to respond to this Request for Information (RFI) are not precluded from responding to future CLMRS requests. The FAA does not intend to publish the results of this Market survey.

II.        NATURE OF COMPETITION

The acquisition strategy for this procurement has not been determined at this time. The FAA intends to consider the information provided in this RFI to develop FAA's future acquisition strategy.  The FAA may use portions of the company’s responses in developing those strategies.

III.      BACKGROUND

     a.  SERVICES OVERVIEW

IFS Software is a Commercial of the Shelf (COTS) Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) Software that the FAA configures for the FAA’s Supply Chain Management ERP (SCM-ERP) platform.  The SCM-ERP platform is all-inclusive of the IFS ERP plus all the interfaces, systems, and technologies.  The IFS ERP has been actively supporting the FAA since implementation in 2016.  The FAA is currently upgrading from IFS App 10 to IFS Cloud with estimated completion in 2027.  The IFS ERP interfaces with as many as 10 other systems performing functions related to Purchase Requests (PRs), Purchase Orders (POs), Shop Orders (SOs), Customer Orders (COs), Projects, Financial Administration, and multiple other functions supporting the FAA Supply Chain.   The SCM-ERP platform (and thereby the IFS ERP) supports three (3) business sectors:  1. Facilities & Equipment Project Materiel Management (F&E PMM) responsible for deploying new systems to the National Airspace System (NAS).  2. The FAA Logistics Center (FAALC) who supplies parts to maintain existing systems within the NAS. 3. Configuration Management Automation (CMA) responsible for the system specifications throughout the NAS. 

The FAA plans to leverage industry input and best practices to continue to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of the FAA Supply Chain.  In doing so, the FAA intends to address opportunities within the technical infrastructure, to implement additional functionalities within the IFS ERP, and to conduct Business Process Re-engineering (BPR) to make best use of the IFS ERP.   Industry’s best practice experience and expertise is required to further progress toward these goals.     

IV.       OBJECTIVES

The new IFS Services should achieve the following high-level objectives:

Improve the effectiveness and efficiency of the FAA Supply Chain by applying industry’s best practices, implementing additional functionalities available within the IFS ERP, and conducting BPR where applicable.
Automate inefficient manual processes by leveraging the IFS ERP. 
Provide informed FAA-specific advice regarding the FAA SCM-ERP infrastructure, and both the Technical and Business Process applications of the IFS ERP.
Achieve a base continuity of knowledge which is sustained through the ebb and flow of work for the SCM-ERP platform.
Provide FAA-specific training when needed related to the IFS ERP.
Introduce new technologies which may further improve the effectiveness and efficiency of the FAA Supply Chain while complying with FAA Security and System Specification requirements.
Support the FAA in establishing and sustaining an enhanced and evolving FAA Supply Chain Strategic Roadmap by leveraging informed FAA resources. 
Support the FAA in achieving more effective and efficient Investment Analysis (IA) by leveraging informed FAA resources throughout the FAA investment lifecycle including but not limited to: Requirements Definition, Solution Design, Work Breakdown Structure definition, Cost Estimating, Schedule Estimating, and Shortfalls / Benefits analysis.     
V.        REQUESTED INFORMATION / QUESTIONS TO INDUSTRY

The FAA plans to evolve and modernize the FAA Supply Chain and the supporting SCM-ERP platform.  A key strategy of the FAA is to leverage industry’s best practices to make the most of the existing technologies within the SCM-ERP and implement new technologies consistent with industry leaders in Supply Chain Management.  The FAA believes that integrating IFS ERP best practices into planning and implementation of strategic initiatives will be a key factor in ensuring the FAA Supply Chain achieves and sets the standard for world-class performance.

Please address the following questions in your market survey responses. Responses should be provided in the order listed below. It is not required to answer every question. However, companies are requested to address questions to the maximum extent possible with the primary focus on questions that fall within their expertise. For items requesting vendor experience, please provide the following for each response: (1) Program/Contract(s) name, (2) Company role (i.e. Prime/Sub), and (3) Customer point of contact information.

To what extent does your company advocate that the FAA should leverage current industry trends?  How will they help mitigate current system shortfalls?
What is your experience in identifying and applying industry’s best practices utilizing the IFS ERP? Specifically, IFS Cloud?  
What are the advantages and disadvantages of IFS Cloud versus IFS App 10 from your experience?  Provide specific examples.
What are specific examples of industry’s best practices with the IFS ERP which have the most impact on Supply Chain effectiveness and efficiency?
What experience do you have providing guidance within Supply Chain in an advisory role (not in an actual software development / IT role)?  What were the results achieved?
What are some of the functionalities within IFS Cloud you have found most impactful?  Provide specific examples.
How would you propose to maintain a continuity of IFS ERP and FAA-specific knowledge within your company in an FAA environment where work and resource requirements fluctuate?
What is your experience in supporting a business in optimizing their use of the IFS ERP to improve effectiveness and efficiency?
What is your experience in Business Process Re-engineering (BPR) in association with the IFS ERP and/or a Supply Chain context?  Results achieved?
What is your experience in leveraging modern interface technologies to streamline and optimize an ERP system infrastructure? With the IFS ERP?
What is your experience in advising a Software Development team in the upgrades and maintenance associated with the IFS ERP?
Describe your company’s experience related to the FAA, or equivalent scope of work within the last 3 years. If no FAA experience is available, describe experience with Supply Chain tools including IFS ERP and otherwise.  Provide specific experience examples, and include any results achieved. Describe any best practices and lessons learned. Describe challenges encountered when deploying/utilizing new technology and how the challenges were overcome. 
What is your experience with SAFe Agile methodology?  In a software development context? In a business context outside of software development?
What Organizational Change Management (OCM) processes has your company used in the past? How might this be applied in the FAA?
What common development platforms has your company used in the past and what methods were used for management between teams and improving accountability?
What experience do you have in applying AI within an ERP and/or Supply Chain environment?  Please specify which AI tools and how you applied them.
Please provide the following administrative/background information for your company:
Name, mailing address, phone number, company website, and e-mail of designated point(s) of contact.
Business Type/Size based on North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) code 541512 Computer Systems Integration Design Consulting Services.
VI.       SUBMISSION INSTRUCTIONS

Interested parties must provide responses in writing. Submissions should be submitted electronically in Microsoft Word format, Times New Roman, font size 12, and in accordance with the following instructions:

Questions must be addressed individually, but it is not required to answer every question. Companies are asked to address questions that fall within their expertise.
The written submission cannot exceed 18 pages (maximum 10 MB document). Note that certain questions may require less than one page response and others may require more. This can be accommodated if all questions are addressed individually in 18 pages or less.
Optional: Any technical diagrams to support a technical solution can be accommodated but cannot exceed three pages (maximum 5 MB for jpeg format).  This can be in addition to the 18 page written submission limitation.
Please address questions to maximum extent possible. Company capability statements are not desired responses and please do not include capability statements.
All submissions must be sent via email. Telephone calls or paper submissions will not be accepted.
The subject line for all submittals must be CLMRS SCM-ERP [Company Name]
Responses must be submitted no later than 3:00 pm CT on October 31, 2025 to the following email: Stephanie.R.Riddle@faa.gov .

NO PHONE CALLS PLEASE.   ALL QUESTIONS MUST BE SUBMITTED IN WRITING VIA EMAIL TO THE CONTRACTING OFFICER.

Responses will not be returned. The FAA is generally not seeking proprietary material.  If the respondent feels there is a benefit to providing certain proprietary material, the respondent must appropriately mark any proprietary or confidential information contained in the market survey/RFI submissions. 

The FAA is not seeking marketing material;
Any and all material submitted – whether proprietary or not – may be used to develop FAA’s acquisition strategy. If respondents do not want specific information used in this manner, then such information should not be submitted;
Providing a response to this Market Survey/RFI neither qualifies respondents for, nor excludes respondents from, responding to a resulting SIR, if any.
The FAA, at its sole discretion, may contact one, some, all, or none of the respondents to the RFI to ask for additional information. This may include, but is not limited to, demonstrations of previously developed tools that companies choose to describe in their responses.
sweetspot-summary: The Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) is seeking expert services to support its Supply Chain Management-Enterprise Resource Planning (SCM-ERP) solution, specifically focusing on the IFS ERP system as part of its Configuration Logistics Maintenance Resource Solutions (CLMRS). The FAA aims to enhance its SCM-ERP platform by leveraging industry best practices, improving operational efficiency, and integrating advanced functionalities, including predictive analytics and AI for inventory optimization. This initiative is crucial for modernizing the FAA's supply chain processes and ensuring effective management of resources across its various sectors. Interested vendors must submit their responses by 3:00 PM CT on October 31, 2025, to Stephanie Riddle at stephanie.r.riddle@faa.gov, adhering to the specified submission guidelines and page limits.
highergov-summary:
Background
The Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) is seeking to enhance its Supply Chain Management - Enterprise Resource Planning (SCM-ERP) solution, which currently operates primarily on IFS software. The FAA's mission is to ensure a safe and efficient global aerospace system, and this contract aims to support the Logistics Center in maintaining and optimizing its operations, which include managing an inventory valued at $735 million.

The FAA is conducting a market survey to gather information from potential contractors capable of providing necessary services related to SCM-ERP solution support.

Work Details
The contractor will provide investment analysis support, solution implementation support, and program management as defined by Task Orders issued by the FAA. Key tasks include:
1) Program Management: Planning, organizing, directing, and controlling activities necessary to meet contract requirements; assigning a Program Manager; delivering a Program Management Plan (PMP); conducting quarterly Program Management Reviews (PMRs);
2) Quality Management: Establishing a quality management system;
3) Software Implementation Support: Providing technical and functional expertise for IFS software; installation and configuration of software modules; training on software modules;
4) Advisory Services: Offering advisory services, training, operational application management services, upgrade support services, and staff augmentation for the IFS platform. Deliverables include monthly project activity reports, project reports analyzing requirements and solutions, and documentation of training materials.

Place of Performance
The work will be performed across multiple locations in the United States, including remote work options.

sam-description:
4NOV2025 ***UPDATE*** QandA posted in attachments. Solicitation due date extended to 10 November 2025 at 10:00 AM Alaska Standard Time. 

***UPDATE*** - A site visit is scheduled for Monday, November 3, 2025, from 10:00 AM to 11:00 AM Alaska Standard Time. If you plan to attend, please coordinate with Mr. Jeremy Allen at Jeremy.M.Allen@usace.army.mil or by phone at 907-250-9708. Location: 3800 Laurance Road, North Pole, Alaska 99705.

The Chena River Lakes Flood Control Project Office owns equipment that requires annual/regular servicing, occasional repairs and troubleshooting. The equipment is located at the Project Office, 3800 Laurance Road, North Pole, Alaska, approximately 18 miles east of Fairbanks, Alaska. The contractor shall provide all supervision, personnel, equipment, tools, materials, transportation, and other items necessary to perform equipment mechanic services at the Chena River Lakes Flood Control Project.
sweetspot-summary: The Department of Defense, through the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers – Alaska District, is seeking qualified contractors to provide annual equipment mechanic services for the Chena River Lakes Flood Control Project Office located in North Pole, Alaska. The procurement involves routine maintenance, repairs, and troubleshooting for a variety of heavy engineering equipment, smaller vehicles, and cranes, with a focus on employing qualified mechanics, including Alaska residents, who possess the necessary certifications and experience. This contract is a total small business set-aside with a not-to-exceed amount of $80,000 per year, covering a one-year base period and two option years, and proposals are due by November 6, 2025, with a site visit scheduled for November 3, 2025. Interested parties can contact Travis Tofi at travis.tofi@usace.army.mil or by phone at 907-753-2714 for further information.
highergov-summary:
Background
The Chena River Lakes Flood Control Project Office, located at 3800 Laurance Road, North Pole, Alaska, approximately 18 miles east of Fairbanks, Alaska, is responsible for managing equipment that requires regular servicing and occasional repairs. The goal of this contract is to ensure the proper maintenance and functionality of this equipment through contracted mechanic services.

Work Details
The contractor shall provide all necessary supervision, personnel, equipment, tools, materials, transportation, and other items required to perform equipment mechanic services. The scope of work includes the maintenance and repair of various types of equipment such as:

1. Air Compressor (Ingersoll-Rand)
2. Backhoe (CAT416E)
3. Cranes (P&H 790-TC and Liebherr 8130HD)
4. Excavator (CAT 349F)
5. Dozer (CAT D 4K LGP)
6. Grader (CAT 140)
7. Terex compact track loader with 8 attachments
8. Loaders (John Deere 544 with various attachments, CAT 938)
9. Tractor (John Deere 4165M with Boom Mower attachment)
10. Snow Machines (two)
11. Side by Side/UTVs (three)
12. Four Wheelers (Honda and Yamaha - four)
13. Towmaster 16 Ton Trailer
14. TWAMCO 25 Ton Trailer
15. Lawnmower Trailer
16. Snowmobile Trailer
17. Trucks (Dodge flatbed, M-series Chevy diesel pick-up, Kenworth Dump Truck)
18. Ranger Boat with Engine & Trailer
19. Work Boat with Engine & Trailer
20. Baldor Emergency Generator (25KW)
21. Bat Wing Mower (Schulte)
22. Generator (trailer mounted)
23. Hagglund SUSVs (two)
24. Disk Plow
25. JCB 3TS track loader
26. Trailer Mounted Heater (ES500B).

Personnel must meet minimum qualifications for heavy engineering equipment mechanics and smaller equipment mechanics, including certifications from recognized industry bodies and relevant experience in maintaining such machinery.

Period of Performance
The contract will be performed over a period not exceeding three years and six months from the date of award.

Place of Performance
The services will be performed at the Chena River Lakes Flood Control Project Office located at 3800 Laurance Road, North Pole, Alaska.
